title: Don't recommend

content: I've had nothing but a bad experience with this app. It will not load up my products and also often doesn't accept a payment from a customer. It's a very unprofessional look for my small business, for this reason I have co tinted to rely on square and it has never let me down.

content: Please bring back the next button in the counting tool and "00" on the numberpad. The prompt to skip/print receipt is redundant - it makes the check out process even slower because you can't open the register to give change before dismissing it.

title: It used to be better
author: Top Reviewer 999
content:
We got Shopify POS to use at Trade shows and it was great.  We signed up to a plan that allowed us to enter customer addresses and charge for shipping.  The change in Shopify plans means we now need to spend $2.3K a month to get the features in our old plan.  With out being able to add address the POS app is almost useless at trade shows.
We also found that we could email the cart to a customer as a quote.  We were using this feature regularly.  In a recent update this feature was removed, making the POS app totally useless now for small businesses.

title: Removing the price override functionality
author: Nooshi8719
content: Why was this removed, it was such a useful tool. Now we must use the calculator manually and deduct which just takes twice as long, i do not understand why it was removed. To make way? To make way for what. Ridiculous update with low IQ developers and design.

title: Printer Bug
author: Dj4bc
content: Since 8.16.2 my docket printers no longer print from any other software or devices. The POS app is trying to be helpful and auto detect printers, but it locks them out for other users. Very frustrating for my cafe which has had no dockets for a week!

title: Updated tracking WTD/MTD
author: crtjm
content: The latest updates took away the drop-down option on POS to track 'yesterday', 'week to date', 'month to date' statistics and its near impossible to react to trade now!

title: Updates are Frustrating
author: Araplam
content:
The latest update is costing my business money!!!!!
As a subscriber of 2 locations per month this is not acceptable!
Whilst it may a good idea to add the Customer Name or phone number in prior to adding shipping address, this may be ok if the items are being delivered to the customer address, this is not ok in our situation as a florist.  99.9% of our customers have their order delivered to someone other than themselves.  I had called support and they have told me that I should use a dummy customer name. The problem is at the point when we enter the dummy customer name (which is each of our store's name) we need to wait for at least 45 sec before the system picks up the name and then prepopulates with the details.  Then we have to delete the details prepopulated and add in the correct recipient and their address.

Our actual customers do not have time for us to "wait" each time and therefore, we have been forced to go back to hand writing the order on a form (going back to what we used to do prior to POS) and then go through the process of adding the sale and delivery information after we have finished with our customer.  This is all double handling and we are having to spend more money on wages!

Your system is not very obliging for the amount of money we are already spending.  We are coming up to Mother's Day where we have many orders to upload over a period of at least 2 weeks.  We cannot afford to have out staff handwriting the order and then spending more time entering the order into the system - we have gone backwards!!!
Would love someone to contact me to discuss and have this fixed before the end of the month!!  Maria - 07 47716767 (Malpara Florist)

title: Wisepad 3 and your updates have made it worse!!
author: Glen.s8
content:
Ever since the new update my wisepad3 will no longer accept automatic touch and go payments. I have to now manually enter cards. It's very annoying!

Otherwise it has so many issues. I see a lot of people complaining about the exact same thing, so please focus on that before adding more features.

title: Extortion
author: Bear1986
content:
I used to love shopify. Over time I've realised I've invested so much time in to this system that I've made myself vulnerable to their ad-hoc changes and price hikes. You cannot trust that the features you have today will be there tomorrow. Or, if the features you need will be moved beyond a paywall that is more than 100% higher than your current costs. Basically, you can't trust them to have your back. 

Don't get this point of sale program if you're a new business, small business, or start-up. Don't get this system ESPECIALLY if you're a single store brick-and-mortar. The basic features you need are not there (being able to save a cart or make an exchange). The basic features are behind the much more expensive tier of pricing. 

Shopify leave out key functions and then advise you to purchase (subscribe) to third party apps to bring those functions in. So, the actual cost of a working system is FAR HIGHER THAN YOU THINK. 

Just, don't do it.

title: Bad ratings
author: shop agent
content:
Their new version is hopeless,makes everything more complicated 
Takes forever to find a product. Massive mistake to launch this useless product.

title: What a rip off this is now. So unhappy
author: ckcybkt
content:
Massivley disappointed in this new upgrade. Unless we fork put a small fortune each month x several locations, all the features we had previously have now been removed. We already pay a lot of money to shopify and now on top of that they want USD $90 per month, per location, to access the features we've already had for years? So unimpressed. Now is not the time to be doing something like this to merchants that were relying on the POS to keep our businesses running! The layout is also awful. Big thumbs DOWN from us!
And in response to the comment left by Shopify, I think you guys are seriously out of touch with your customers. This basic LITE version doesn't even have an ability to exchange?! For an instore POS system, you have to go through a crazy process of doing a refund, emailing the customer a gift card, waiting till that comes through on their phone (if they have it with them), using the gift card to credit the balance. Have you ever experienced that process yourselves in store as either a retailer or a consumer? It's insane. 
Thank you for the suggestion of contacting your support. I did that, and then waited 9 days for a response. If I could give this review negative stars I would do so!

title: New pricing model is extortion
author: My Eyez are bleeding
content:
The switch to the new pricing model for POS Pro/Lite is an absolute ripoff.

Essential features that were present in the previous (free) POS are suddenly placed behind a forced upgrade and a steep paywall, right in the middle of some of the most challenging economic conditions we've ever seen.

You are effectively holding small businesses hostage with this change and we will be reporting this to the ACCC.

You should be ashamed of yourselves.

FIX IT URGENTLY

title: New POS upgrade needs work URGENTLY
author: Sarah atkins
content:
I LOVED the previous Shopify pos app. 

It HAD all the features we need. 

Since upgrading, I do not believe we should have to pay US $85/month just to be able to have the same functions and features as we had before. That's roughly AU$125-$130 PER MONTH.   

We're now missing the ability to: 

1.     Initiate a lay-by (partially paid order) 
This is an enormous oversight and needs urgent attention. OR if the ability exists, some instruction on how to. 
URGENT ATTENTION REQUIRED. 

2.    Search for a partially paid order using the customer name, the process which makes the most sense. We now have to scroll through the list of orders (all orders) to see which ones are partially paid, it's impossible. 
URGENT ATTENTION REQUIRED. 

3.    Staff pins? Trying to issue my staff a PIN number via admin as can't work how to do it in POS app.  (they had one each before, 5 staff in total) and all I get is "Pin is already taken". Plus I can't see my staff listed in Shopify admin. 
AGAIN, URGENT ATTENTION REQUIRED. 

4.    The "add custom sale" tile takes you to a screen where it's very easy to add the amount, BUT the design and layout really leads you to press the "+1" button rather than the "add to cart" button which seems quite hidden in the top right corner. 
URGENT ATTENTION REQUIRED. 

5.    Add to cart. Paying an extra $85 (US!) per month is an extreme extra cost for a feature that was previously included as standard. The technology has not changed for this feature. 
URGENT ATTENTION REQUIRED.  

6.   Remove extra steps. Please, to be exact,  a fourth option in the bottom row toolbar, that is a simple "back to checkout" option. I should not have to press 5 buttons (at minimum) to get back to the cart page. It takes valuable time and is extremely frustrating. 
URGENT ATTENTION REQUIRED. 

Speed and accuracy are the most important things to consider in a busy retail environment.

This upgrade has so much potential, but considering the above is clunky and does not consider the merchant in a retail environment at all. 

If you're going to upgrade and rebuild an app in complete usability and layout, then the existing services should still be available for the same subscription rate. We're already paying for a system which now has LESS features, and your profit is going up, right? 

These matters need urgent attention, as we are heading into the Christmas period and cannot afford more time and money spent for a system that worked perfectly well before the update. 

It pains me to consider looking at other options than Shopify. I do not want to retrain my staff, or rebuild my store or POS system. 

Please fix these issues as a matter of extreme urgency. 
In the future when an upgrade is planned (BEFORE it is implemented) I strongly suggest deeper level merchant liaison and feedback, and restructure based on this feedback. 

Still a Shopify fan, just not a happy one at the moment. 
As previously mentioned, the above mentioned matters were already standard prior to the upgrade. 

Isn't Shopify as a corporation making enough money from subscriptions and Addons and percentages of online sales, without adding on the massive new POS fees just for the same features we had?

Please work these UX issues out as a matter of urgency, or my money (your profit) walks.

title: Very disappointing
author: Lemmons Store
content: We have used the previous version for a few years, it isn't perfect but you can do what you need. The new version is very average, has all these new features that are supposed to make it great but hasn't addressed any of the previous things that needed fixing. Now it is going to cost much more. Basic functions like scanning products are very glitchy, sometimes work easily sometimes don't work at all with the scanner we have used for over 2 years. Very average product for the price now, would be fine if your needs were very basic, if you have products with lots of variants, customer accounts, accept appro's & returns, need accounts to sub total for customer payments, find one that at least you get the features you need for the money.

title: Basics covered. Not yet ready for Australia
author: Tobias G
content:
Good overall POS with some decent features. 
Simple features missing though such as cash rounding, fulfilment at POS, TYRO integration (or other EFTPOS terminal), and global sales holds. 
Having a diverse range of apps to select from is ok, but some basics could be covered out of the box such as the ability to process/retrieve a saved draft order via POS rather than having to pay for an app to be able to do this.

title: Love it!

content:
We use POS for our pop up shops through Australia and its been nothing but amazing. 
The only thing that could make it better is barcode password for staff instead of numbers.

title: Keeps crashing

content: New update keeps crashing. Disappointing.

title: Garbage
author: Allsdeapps
content: What is up with Shopify and making the most useless software where you need 1000 apps to get anything done properly.

title: Requires some development still
author: Lachlan7
content:
Shopify POS is sluggish when processing transactions. We have download internet speed of over 100mbps yet the pos takes a long time to process (compared to square).
In Australia our staff would like to see:
- Integrated with payment eftpos terminals such as tyro
- Fast transaction button to quickly take cash/card. There are too many buttons/pages to press in one transaction. Especially when you try square and their system is so quick and easy!
- Drag and drop products on the homescreen instead of them listed in alphabetical order
- Staff login needs improving. The pin system isn't efficient as with multi sites and huge staff, pin codes are taken and easy to use another persons login

For the money you pay for POS being $50 usd per month, you would expect a better faster, easy pos system.

author: Brinno
content:
We use this app to track sales at our market. It's great because it keeps our stock up to date on the website instantly. Easy to use and immediately updates in Shopify reports etc.

Two requests:

1) can you create a location prompt when opening the app (at least at start of day), I have staff that forget to swap locations and then the reports don't match. 
Or a way to change location in order if it's entered incorrectly?

2)when is the Shopify POS payments mobile swipe machine going to be available in Australia?

Thank you.

title: Orders tab not suitable for multiple locations
author: Hannahgorg
content:
This app has one major flaw for companies that have more than one physical location.

Currently if a sale is made in "store 1" the staff in "store 2" can see the sale in the "orders" tab. In fact they can see every sale your entire business makes. I do not want my staff to know my turnover figures. It can also discourage staff from trying if they can see another store is hitting the targets for them.

Perhaps a "show only orders from this ipad" in the location setting. Or an option to limit the "POS only" staff to only seeing orders from the iPads location.

title: Fantastic worked straight away
author: Rweetbix
content: This is a great app, easy to setup and use.  It'll be great when Laybys are allowed.
